contentrichtext.text: '''John Holmes''', '''Jon Holmes''', '''Jonathan Holmes''' may refer to: {{tocright}} == Arts and entertainment == * [[John Clellon Holmes]] (1926–1988), poet, novelist and essayist of the Beat Generation * [[John Eric Holmes]] (1930–2010), author and promoter of fantasy role-playing games * [[John Holmes (composer)]] (died 1629), English cathedral musician and Renaissance composer * [[John Holmes (poet)]] (1904–1962), poet whose work appears in the ''Faber Book of Modern American Verse'' * [[John Holmes (pornographic actor)]] (1944–1988), pornographic film star and suspect in the Wonderland Murders case * [[Jon Holmes]] (born 1973), British comedy writer and broadcaster * [[Jonathan Holmes (theatre director)]] (born 1975), UK theatre director and writer == Athletes and sportsmen == * [[John B. Holmes]] (born 1982), American golfer better known as J.B. Holmes * [[John Holmes (cricketer)]] (1924–1980), English cricketer better known as Rodney Holmes * [[John Holmes (driver)]] or Jackie Holmes (1920–1995), American race car driver * [[John Holmes (rugby league)]] (1952–2009), English former rugby league footballer ==Church men== * [[John Haynes Holmes]] (1879–1964), American churchman and pacifist * [[John Holmes (bishop)]] (died 1904), Anglican colonial bishop == Diplomats == * [[John Holmes (British diplomat)]] (born 1951), British diplomat * [[John T. Holmes]], [[Ambassadors and High Commissioners from Canada|Canadian ambassador to Indonesia]] and East Timor * [[John Wendell Holmes]] (1910–1988), Canadian diplomat and academic == Educators == * [[John Clough Holmes]] (1809–1887), merchant and progenitor of the Agricultural College of the State of Michigan * [[John Holmes (professor)]], University of Queensland professor * [[John Holmes (schoolmaster)]] (1703–1760), Master of Gresham's School in Norfolk, England ==Military men and mercenaries== * [[John Holmes (British Army officer)]] (born 1949), British general * [[John Holmes (mercenary)]], 19th century Anglo-Indian mercenary * [[John Holmes (Royal Navy officer)]] (1640?–1683), English naval officer == Politicians == * [[John Edwin Holmes]] (1809–1863), first Lieutenant Governor of Wisconsin * [[John Holmes (by 1529-83)]], MP for [[Ripon (UK Parliament constituency)|Ripon]] and Boroughbridge * [[John Holmes (died 1556 or later)]], MP for [[Rye (UK Parliament constituency)]] * [[John Holmes (New Zealand politician)]] (1831–1910), New Zealand Member of Parliament * [[John Holmes (Nova Scotia politician)]] (1789–1876), Canadian Senator * [[John Holmes (Ontario politician)]] (1828–1879), Canadian MP * [[John Holmes (Maine)]] (1773–1843), member of the U.S. House of Representatives from Maine * [[John Robert Holmes]] (1927–2011), Canadian MP == Fictional character == * [[Auguste Lupa]] (also known as John Hamish Adler Holmes), fictional character in two pastiche novels by author John Lescroart ==See also== * [[John Cecil Holm]] (1904–1981), American dramatist * [[John Holm]], Canadian politician * [[Jonathan Holmes]], journalist and broadcaster {{hndis|Holmes, John}}
